meanings.definition: A line or mark left by the tide on a shore.
meanings.sent1: The tidemarks on the beach showed how far the water had come up.
meanings.sent2: The sailor looked at the tidemarks to see if the tide was coming in or going out.
meanings.sent3: The kids played a game to see who could jump over the tidemarks without getting wet.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the tidemarks glowed like golden ribbons on the sand.
meanings.sent5: The artist sketched the tidemarks with great detail, capturing the beauty of nature's patterns.

meanings.definition: A line or mark indicating the highest or lowest level reached by a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The tidemarks on the rocks showed how high the waves had splashed.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the tidemarks to understand the water levels during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The tidemarks on the boat made it look like it was wearing a waterline belt.
meanings.sent4: The tidemarks on the riverbank revealed the secrets of the water's journey.
meanings.sent5: The tidemarks etched into the mud were like nature's own record of the tides.
